p: Zataria multiflora is an aromatic plant native from Iran and Afghanistan that is rich in the monoterpenoids carvacrol (or cymophenol) and thymol [ 115]. A 0.03% v/ v of Z. multiflora extracts were bacteriostatic for E. coli O157, but sub-inhibitory concentrations reduced the induction of 933 W, measured by quantifying the expression of Stx2 [ 83]. Several other compounds, including several derivatives of gallic acid, showed antiviral activity in vitro measured with the MTT method and estimated by the inhibition of viral cytopathic effects [ 116].
